N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4002.26 - License requirements for exercise rider

State Regulations

In addition to the requirements of sections
4002.8
and
4002.29
of this Part: (a) An exercise rider license may be issued
only to an applicant who has received and submitted an endorsement of the head
outrider and a steward in a form and manner approved by the commission. The
head outrider, by making an endorsement, certifies that the applicant has been
observed riding one or more horses on the racetrack and has an ability to
navigate safely and respond safely to track conditions. (b) An applicant for an initial exercise
rider license shall provide evidence of employment by a licensed trainer, except as otherwise provided under this Part. (c) An exercise rider shall not be authorized
to ride from a starting gate unless the exercise rider has received the
endorsement of the starter certifying that the exercise rider has demonstrated
knowledge of starting gate procedures and is satisfied that the exercise rider
can break safely from a starting gate. (d) An outrider may require an exercise rider
during the first six months of initial licensure as an exercise rider to wear a
helmet cover and vest and/or an armband of a distinctive color while training. Notes
